1.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
Babel (i.e. Babylon), including Babylonia and the Babylonian empire
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

2.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a willow (from the use of osiers as wattles)
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
causing to howl, i.e. an oppressor
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

4.brief: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
foreign, or (concretely) a foreigner, or (abstractly) heathendom

5.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

6.brief: properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

7.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to be (causatively, make) bare; hence, to empty, pour out, demolish
to be (causatively, make) bare; hence, to empty, pour out, demolish
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)

8.brief: a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Babel (i.e. Babylon), including Babylonia and the Babylonian empire
properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage
happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
treatment, i.e. an act (of good or ill); by implication, service or requital
to treat a person (well or ill), i.e. benefit or requite; by implication (of toil), to ripen, i.e. (specifically) to wean

9.brief: happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
to dash to pieces, or scatter
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
